meanings.definition: Complaining in a feeble or petulant way.
meanings.sent1: The whiney child kept asking for more candy.
meanings.sent2: She always had a whiney tone when things didn't go her way.
meanings.sent3: The whiney puppy begged for attention by pawing at its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her whiney voice echoed through the room, irritating everyone.
meanings.sent5: The whiney customer demanded to speak to the manager for the third time.

meanings.sent1: The whiney of the car engine signaled a potential problem.
meanings.sent2: The constant whiney of the mosquito kept everyone awake at night.
meanings.sent3: The whiney of the old door hinges made the house seem haunted.
meanings.sent4: The whiney of the violin filled the concert hall with a melancholic melody.
meanings.sent5: The whiney of the teapot indicated that the water was boiling.
